business.headline: Sensex tanks 500 points, Nifty below 25,000; Infosys down 2%Sensex tanks 500 points, Nifty below 25,000; Infosys down 2%

Arisinfra Solutions IPO allotment out: Here's how to check status and latest GMPInvestors who took part in the public issue can check their allotment status online through the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) website or the official registrar for the IPO, Link Intime India Private Ltd.

Stock market opening: Sensex, Nifty to crash today after US attack on Iran?The Gift Nifty futures, as of 8:10 am, were trading at 25,015, indicating a lower opening compared to the previous close of 25,112.4. Benchmark indices rose about 1.6% last week, driven by gains in financial stocks, which provided some cushion against the geopolitical tensions.

Stocks to watch on June 23: TCS, Waree Renewable, HAL, BEL, MakeMyTripReports suggest the United States may have bombed a nuclear facility in Iran, triggering fresh concerns over the conflict with Israel. These developments could impact market sentiment on Dalal Street at the start of the week.

Why India may not feel the heat if Iran closes Strait of HormuzIndia, which has traditionally sourced its oil from the Middle East and more recently from Russia, is unlikely to see a major impact on its energy reserves if Iran decides to shut down the vital oil corridor of the Strait of Hormuz.

Generative AI must pay for using copyright content, says DNPAThe Digital News Publishers Association said it "firmly believes that utilising the content of digital news publishers, without consent, for AI training and subsequent generative AI applications, such as search assistance and information purposes, constitutes an infringement of copyright."

Two new GST levies may replace compensation cess, but at what cost?Health and Clean Energy levies may replace the Compensation Cess, but tax experts warn of rising compliance burdens and fresh coordination challenges.

Tesla to open first showroom in Mumbai next month, sell China-made EVs: ReportTesla is set to open its first showroom in Mumbai next month and sell Model Y rear-wheel-drive SUVs shipped from Tesla's China factory as the company seeks expansion in the world's third-biggest automobile market, Bloomberg News reported.

India's growth lies in its heartland: Adani Enterprises Director Pranav AdaniThe remarks came as part of a broader statement of intent from the newly launched Chintan Research Foundation, which Adani said would focus on three critical areas: climate change, trade, and geopolitics.

Sensex ends 1,046 points higher, Nifty above 25,100; Bharti Airtel jumps 3%The S&P BSE Sensex jumped 1,046.30 points to end at 82,408.17, while the NSE Nifty50 added 319.50 points to close at 25,112.40.

Is lifestyle inflation fuelling debt among India's middle class?Lifestyle inflation is no longer a silent threat. It is reshaping how India's middle class earns, spends and saves. It fuels debt, shrinks buffers and puts long-term financial goals at risk.

Planning to retire at 40? Here's what it really takesThe idea of retiring at 40 sounds almost rebellious. Stop working just when most people are hitting their career peak, and live the rest of your life on your own terms. No bosses, no Monday blues, no waiting for the weekend. But can you do it?

entertainment.headline: Karisma Kapoor, Kareena-Saif offer prayers at Sunjay Kapur's memorial meetKarisma Kapoor, along with her children, Samaira and Kiaan, attended the prayer meet of her ex-husband Sunjay Kapur in Delhi. The actor was joined by her sister Kareena Kapoor and Saif Ali Khan.

Diljit Dosanjh skips India release of Sardaar Ji 3 starring Pak actor Hania Aamir'Sardaar Ji 3', featuring Diljit Dosanjh and Pakistani actor Hania Aamir, will not release in India due to the Indian film industry's ban on Pakistani actors. The film is set for an overseas release on June 27 and is a horror comedy satire on ghostbusting.

Actor Trisha calls Thalapathy Vijay bestest in adorable birthday post. Viral picActor Trisha Krishnan shared a cute birthday post for her long-time friend, Thalapathy Vijay. She called him 'bestest' in her Instagram post.

Salman Khan's casual Sunday vibe wins fans over. See picActor Salman Khan on Sunday shared his new photo on Instagram. The photo created excitement amongst his fans, who complimented his style and mannerisms.

Jaideep Ahlawat joins King, says Shah Rukh Khan convinced Siddharth AnandActor Jaideep Ahlawat will also be seen in the much-anticipated film 'King'. The actor confirmed joining the cast and said that director Siddharth Anand was initially hesitant to offer him the film.

Thalapathy Vijay turns 51: Atlee, Dulquer Salman and celebs extend wishesThalapathy Vijay, who is celebrating his 51th birthday on Sunday, received wishes from the big wigs of Tamil film industry. Filmmaker Atlee shared a picture of fans celebrating the re-release of 'Mersal' to wish the actor on Instagram.

Kajol says love stories have evolved but DDLJ would still win hearts todayKajol feels that while love stories have evolved with time, a classic like 'Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge' would still resonate with today's audience. In an exclusive interview with India Today, she emphasised that timeless films with strong storytelling and memorable music continue to hold their charm.

Karisma Kapoor in Delhi with Kareena and Saif for Sunjay Kapur's prayer meetActor Karisma Kapoor is in New Delhi with her family to attend the prayer service of her ex-husband Sunjay Kapoor. Actors Kareena Kapoor Khan and Saif Ali Khan also accompanied her.

Salman Khan reacts to trespassing incident at Galaxy: Definitely didn't call herA month after the trespassing incident at his Galaxy apartment, Salman Khan reacted to the incident. He addressed it during his appearance on 'The Great Indian Kapil Show'.

Case against actor Vijay Deverakonda under SC/ST Act for remarks on tribal community A case has been filed against actor Vijay Deverakonda for his remarks on the tribal community at Suriya's 'Retro' event. Vijay had issued an apology.

Varun Dhawan and Ahan Shetty get lost in Pune, board crowded metro to reach hotelActors Varun Dhawan and Ahan Shetty travelled in a crowded metro recently after they got lost in Pune. They are shooting for 'Border 2' in the city.

Rapper Tommy Genesis faces backlash for dressing as Maa Kali in explicit music videoA Canadian rapper is facing backlash for portraying Maa Kali in an explicit video. The act has sparked outrage and renewed debate over cultural appropriation in entertainment.

Kuberaa box office Day 2: Dhanush's crime-thriller shows growth, crosses Rs 30 crore'Kuberaa' is going strong at the box office and has earned Rs 30 crore. On day 2, the Dhanush-starrer earned Rs 16 crore at the box office.

Sitaare Zameen Par box office Day 2: Aamir's film outshines itself, earns Rs 30 croreAamir Khan's 'Sitaare Zameen Par' is steadily winning over audiences, showing promising signs at the box office. Boosted by positive word of mouth, the film continued to draw consistent footfall on Day 2, reflecting growing momentum after a solid opening.
Dipika Kakar wishes son Ruhaan on 2nd birthday with adorable candid videoV actor Dipika Kakar shared an adorable birthday wish for her son Ruhaan. The little munchkin turned two on June 22.

Aandhi: A cinematic storm that echoed Indira's era'Aandhi' is a classic political satire that delicately portrays the personal sacrifices behind public power, drawing subtle parallels with Indira Gandhi's life. The film remains a timeless gem, celebrated for its nuanced storytelling and memorable performances in Indian cinema.

Salman Khan, 59, says he has brain aneurysm and AV malformationSalman Khan spoke candidly about his severe health issues, including trigeminal neuralgia, AV malformation and brain aneurysm, during his appearance on The Great Indian Kapil Show.
Marathi actor Tushar Ghadigaonkar dies by suicide at 34Marathi actor Tushar Ghadigaonkar was found dead in his Goregaon West flat. Police suspect suicide caused by prolonged stress over lack of work.

Amitabh Bachchan admires son Abhishek, calls him true inheritor in new postAmitabh Bachchan has expressed heartfelt admiration for his son Abhishek Bachchan's dedication and courage as an artist. The proud father also shared his blessings for his upcoming film 'Kaalidhar Laapata'.

general news.headline: Trump boasts of 'monumental damage' to Iran's nuke sites, calls it bullseye strikeThe strikes came as a major escalation and the first direct US military involvement in the conflict alongside Israel.

AAP leads in Visavadar and Ludhiana, Congress in Nilambur, TMC ahead in Kaliganj  Live UpdatesAssembly Bypoll Result 2025 Live Updates: The bypoll results for five constituencies across four states - Bengal, Punjab, Kerala and Gujarat - will be announced today. Bypolls were held in two seats in Gujarat - Visavadar and Kadi - and one each in Punjab (Ludhiana West), Kerala (Nilambur) and Bengal (Kaliganj).

Enemy made grave big mistake, must be punished: Khamenei on US strikesIran's Supreme Leader Khamenei condemned US strikes on nuclear sites, warning of harsh retaliation. He called the attacks a grave crime by the "Zionist enemy" that must be punished. Iran's President also warned of a strong response to US aggression.

Yashasvi slammed for dropped catches as India slip to 5-year low in Leeds TestENG vs IND, 1st Test: Yashasvi Jaiswal's multiple dropped catches put India under pressure in the Headingley Test. Jasprit Bumrah's five-wicket haul helped India secure a narrow lead despite fielding setbacks.

Watch: US B-2 bombers that dropped massive bunker-busters on Iran return homeThe B-2 stealth bombers that struck Iran's nuclear sites have safely returned to Whiteman Air Force Base in Missouri. The mission, named Operation Midnight Hammer, involved 7 B-2s and over 125 US aircraft, delivering a precise strike on key nuclear facilities in Iran.

Operation Midnight Hammer: US details how it struck Iran's N-sites in 25 minutesOperation Midnight Hammer - This was the name given by the US following its air strikes on Iran's three nuclear sites. It involved over 125 aircraft and bombers being deployed in the Pacific as a "decoy" in an operation that lasted 25 minutes.

News Menu, June 23: Iran threatens Strait of Hormuz closure, rain alert for DelhiIn today's News Menu: Iran's threat to close key sea trade route of the Strait of Hormuz after US airstrikes on its nuclear facilities, Nitish Kumar declared NDA's chief ministerial candidate for Bihar polls, weather department issues yellow alert of rain for Delhi.

Iran fires fresh missile at central Israel, Tel Aviv says it was interceptedIran's media have claimed that the nuclear sites destroyed in Sunday's US bombings are presently being rebuilt by Iran's Atomic Energy Agency. Meanwhile, the US State Department has issued a Worldwide Caution alert, warning American citizens to exercise increased vigilance while travelling abroad. 

The Israeli Defence Forces also stated that around 20 Israeli Air Force fighter jets carried out intelligence-based strikes using over 30 munitions across several locations in Iran, including Kermanshah, Hamedan, and Tehran.

Karun Nair comeback story: One more chance, 3006 days laterIndia tour of England: Karun Nair returned to the Test side after 3006 days, earning a place in Shubman Gill's new-look India. After a record-breaking triple century in 2016, he had vanished from the team without a goodbye. But he never gave up.

Punjab realtor shoots wife, son and then himself; all found dead in car: CopsA 45-year-old realtor, his wife and their son were found dead inside a car in Punjab's Patiala district. Police suspect that the property dealer first shot his wife and then his son, before taking his own life.

Iran turns to Russia after US strike, top Putin aide hints at nuke supportIn a series of posts on X, Dmitry Medvedev said the US operation-targeting sites in Isfahan, Natanz, and Fordow - had not only failed to achieve its objective but had, in fact, produced the opposite result.

Kerala By-Election 2025 Live: Congress leads after first round of counting in Nilambur bypollAssembly Bypoll Result 2025 Live Updates: The Election Commission of India will announce the results of Nilambur Assembly bypolls today. The counting of votes began at 8 am.

Iran to block key oil choke point after US strikes? Why Strait of Hormuz mattersIf Iran goes ahead and shuts down the Strait of Hormuz, through which 20 per cent of daily global oil consumption passes, it would disrupt trade flows, send oil prices shooting up and potentially destabilising the global economy.

Pak PM to chair high-level security meeting today, US-Iran fallout on agendaPakistan's top civil and military leadership will convene today for the first National Security Committee meeting since the April Pahalgam attack, amid regional tensions and fallout from the US attack on Iran's nuclear sites.

Did US use Indian airspace to strike Iran nuke sites? Government clarifiesThe Press Information Bureau (PIB) in a fact check, said that the route taken by the B2 bombers was explained by US Joint Chiefs of Staff Chair Gen. Dan Caine during a press briefing and Indian airspace was not used for the strike.

Don't want to create a scene: Jasprit Bumrah on India's poor fielding efforts on Day 3Jasprit Bumrah shared his thoughts after missing out on a few wickets due to dropped catches and no-balls. The pacer said he has no intention of putting additional pressure on his teammates, adding that such moments are part and parcel of the game.

Indian man forced to leave Dubai after losing job writes painful goodbye postAfter losing his job, an Indian man shared an emotional post about leaving Dubai, remembering his five years of struggle, memories, and an unexpected goodbye.

Why India may not feel the heat if Iran closes Strait of HormuzIndia, which has traditionally sourced its oil from the Middle East and more recently from Russia, is unlikely to see a major impact on its energy reserves if Iran decides to shut down the vital oil corridor of the Strait of Hormuz.

AAP candidate Sanjeev Arora leads after 1st round of counting, Congress 2ndLudhiana West Assembly Results Live Updates: The race for the Ludhiana (West) Assembly seat of Punjab is going to be a four-way contest with the Arvind Kejriwal-led Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) looking to retain the seat following sitting party MLA Gurpreet Singh Gogi's death. The party has fielded Rajya Sabha MP Sanjeev Arora to retain its hold on the urban seat. Arora faces Bharat Bhushan Ashu from the Congress, Jiwan Gupta from the BJP, and Parupkar Singh Ghumman from the Shiromani Akali Dal. Among the five Assembly seats that went to bypolls on June 19, Ludhiana (West) recorded the lowest voter turnout at 51.33%. Stay tuned to IndiaToday.in for the latest updates.

What US strikes on Iran N-sites could lead to: 5 big pointsUS President Donald Trump's decision to do what he vowed not to could lead to a shake-up in the Middle East. The strikes curb Iran's power while revealing American assertions. However, this could also lead to another "forever war" for the US and skyrocketing oil prices for the world.

Trinamool takes early lead in Bengal bypoll as counting of postal votes underwayKaliganj, West Bengal By-Election Results Live Updates: Counting of votes for the high-stakes by-election to West Bengal's Kaliganj Assembly seat in Nadia district began at 8 am today, with the Election Commission deploying elaborate security and logistical arrangements to ensure a smooth process. The bypoll, held on June 19, saw a voter turnout of 69.85 per cent. It was necessitated by the death of sitting Trinamool Congress (TMC) MLA Nasiruddin Ahamed in February this year. The Mamata Banerjee-led party has fielded Nasiruddin Ahamed's daughter, Alifa Ahamed, in an attempt to retain the seat. The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) has put forward Ashis Ghosh, while Congress candidate Kabil Uddin Shaikh is contesting with the backing of the CPI(M), marking another joint effort by the Congress-Left alliance. Stay tuned to IndiaToday.in for the latest updates.

Kadi, Visavdar bypoll results today, counting of votes beginsKadi, Visavadar Gujarat By-Election Results Live Updates: Results of the bypolls for the Kadi and Visavadar Assembly seats of Gujarat will be announced today. In Kadi, the BJP has fielded Rajendra Chavda, the Congress has nominated Ramesh Chavda, and AAP has fielded Jagdish Chavda. The contest could reveal the Dalit community's voting patterns in the region. The seat fell vacant after the death of BJP MLA Karsanbhai Solanki.  
In Visavadar, the BJP has bet on Kirit Patel, who is pitted against the Congress's Nitin Ranpariya. The AAP has fielded prominent party leader Gopal Italia, making it a triangular contest. On June 19, Visavadar reported a turnout of 56.89%, while Kadi saw a relatively lower figure at 57.90%. Stay tuned to IndiaToday.in for the latest updates.

Regime change? Trump says it's inevitable if leaders fail to make Iran great againUS President Trump questioned the future of Iran's regime after US strikes hit key nuclear sites. Trump praised the military for "monumental" damage and safe returns. Israel's Netanyahu said Iran is racing toward nuclear weapons, while missile exchanges between Iran and Israel raise tensions further.

Operation Sindhu: First batch of 160 Indians evacuated from Israel through JordanIndian missions in Jordan and Israel organised the first batch of evacuation from Israel as the Indian nationals living in Israel constantly grappled with the sounds of sirens, frequently taking cover in bunkers and fortified safe rooms from incoming missiles and drones from Iran.

sports.headline: Karun Nair comeback story: One more chance, 3006 days laterIndia tour of England: Karun Nair returned to the Test side after 3006 days, earning a place in Shubman Gill's new-look India. After a record-breaking triple century in 2016, he had vanished from the team without a goodbye. But he never gave up.

Jasprit Bumrah is an absolute genius: Hussain likens India pacer to Shane WarneFormer England captain Nasser Hussain lavished praise on Jasprit Bumrah, calling him an "absolute genius" and comparing his ability to leave batters clueless to that of legendary leg-spinner Shane Warne.

Double Olympic medallist Lalit Upadhyay retires from international hockeyTwo-time Olympic medallist and Indian forward Lalit Kumar Upadhyay announced his retirement from international hockey on Sunday, shortly after India concluded their FIH Pro League campaign with a 4-3 victory over Belgium.

Little bit of Rishabh Pant in Harry Brook: Pujara makes bold comparisonCheteshwar Pujara made a bold comparison as he saw glimpses of Rishabh Pant in English batting star Harry Brook. The latter scored 99 runs, narrowly missing out on a century, but his contribution was crucial in helping England secure a slender first-innings lead

Total team man KL Rahul doesn't know how good a player he is: Sunil GavaskarSunil Gavaskar feels that KL Rahul is yet to achieve his full potential after the Indian opener made another fine start with the bat for India against England. Rahul remained unbeaten on 47 as India ended the day on 90 for two.

Let the noise do its thing: Pope backed his instincts to hit hundred in LeedsOllie Pope revealed that despite recent criticism, he chose to back himself and trust his instincts approach that led to his return to form, as he looks to cement his place as England's number three batter in the long run.

Shastri slams sloppy fielding as England narrows lead at HeadingleyRavi Shastri was critical of India's fielding efforts in the Leeds Test, saying that they should have had a 150-plus lead at the end of England's first innings. The Indian fielders gave the likes of Ben Duckett, Ollie Pope, and Harry Brook lifelines in Leeds, and England ultimately conceded just a six-run lead.

Don't want to create a scene: Jasprit Bumrah on India's poor fielding efforts on Day 3Jasprit Bumrah shared his thoughts after missing out on a few wickets due to dropped catches and no-balls. The pacer said he has no intention of putting additional pressure on his teammates, adding that such moments are part and parcel of the game.

Call it the Tendulkar-Anderson Trophy: Gavaskar slams ECB's jarring moveSunil Gavaskar was critical of the England Cricket Board for having James Anderson's name ahead of Sachin Tendulkar when renaming the Pataudi Trophy to the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy.

Jasprit Bumrah's fiery yorker to critics: They said I'd last only six monthsEngland vs India: Jasprit Bumrah launched an explosive rant against his critics, saying they have constantly written his career off. Bumrah was the star of the show with the ball as he picked up five wickets for 83 runs on Day 3 of the first Test.

Carlos Alcaraz wins Queens before Wimbledon defence, Bublik stuns Medvedev in HalleCarlos Alcaraz sent a message to the rest of the world, winning the Queen's Club crown in London before his Wimbledon title defence. Meanwhile, Alexander Bublik, who stunned Jannik Sinner in Halle, went on to win the ATP 500 tournament by beating Daniil Medvedev in the final on Sunday.

The Indian fielders gave the likes of Ben Duckett, Ollie Pope, and Harry Brook lifelines in Leeds, and England ultimately conceded just a six-run lead.

The pacer said he has no intention of putting additional pressure on his teammates, adding that such moments are part and parcel of the game.

Bumrah was the star of the show with the ball as he picked up five wickets for 83 runs on Day 3 of the first Test.

Meanwhile, Alexander Bublik, who stunned Jannik Sinner in Halle, went on to win the ATP 500 tournament by beating Daniil Medvedev in the final on Sunday.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
